info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued November 20 at 7:04AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... The Virginia Department of Environmental Quality has issued a health alert for today due to smoke from the Matts Creek wildfire in Bedford County. The areas affected are the counties of Bedford, Botetourt, Alleghany, Bath, Amherst, Rockbridge, Campbell, and the city of Lynchburg whenever smoke is present. Winds should push smoke more towards counties located southwest to northwest of the fire as the day progresses. Air quality measurements from US Forest Service air monitors in Bedford and Big Island have been indicating very unhealthy to hazardous pollution concentrations, respectively, this morning. People in those areas with existing heart or lung ailments (including asthma), older adults, children and teenagers, minority populations, and outdoor workers should avoid physical activity outdoors. Everyone else in those areas should avoid long or intense activities. For the other areas, active children and older adults should limit or reschedule strenuous outdoor activities until smoke conditions improve. People unusually sensitive to air pollution, especially those with heart or lung disease (including asthma), should avoid strenuous outdoor activities until conditions improve. People with asthma should follow their asthma action plans and keep quick-relief medicine handy. If you can see/smell smoke near the ground, consider Code Orange or worse conditions and take the necessary precautions, especially if you have existing heart or lung ailments including asthma. For additional information...please visit the Virginia Department of of Environmental Quality atwww.deq.virginia.gov/our- programs/air/monitoring-assessments/air-quality-forecast
